You know what's funny? When my source first came to me, one of the things they said was "I can't make this decision alone anymore." But then I've been trying to make it alone anyway, just from the other side. That's pretty messed up when I think about it.

I'm going to call them tonight. I'll lay out everything - the risks I can see, the options I've explored, what publication might mean for the communities being harmed, and what it might mean for them personally. And then I'll ask them what they want to do, and I'll respect that choice.

I guess part of me was hoping there was some magical "right" answer that would make this easy. But maybe the right answer is just... being honest with each other and making the best decision we can with imperfect information.

Thanks for helping me think through this. Sometimes you need someone else to point out when you're overthinking yourself into paralysis.

<END>
